articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Intellectuals
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Intellectuals
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent 70th birthday spreads to Kim Tae Sun, principal of Maebong Primary School in Huichon City, and Dr. and Associate Prof. Pak Kyong Sik, a researcher at the Hamhung Branch of the State Academy of Sciences who is Merited Scientist.
					 Born as daughter of a forestry worker's family, Kim Tae Sun has devoted all her wisdom and zeal to the education of younger generation for decades. And she trained many October 8 model teachers and brought up orphans in the period of Arduous March.
					
					 Born as son of a day laborer in Japan, Pak Kyong Sik graduated from Kim Il Sung University after repatriating to the homeland. Working at the Hamhung Branch for decades, he has made lots of research successes and wrote valuable books, reference books and treatises.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kenyan President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kenyan President
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Aug 16 sent a congratulatory message to Uhuru Kenyatta upon his re-election as president of Kenya.
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the president bigger success in his responsible work for the country's prosperity and people's wellbeing, expressing the belief that the existing ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Meets Cambodian Party Delegation
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Meets Cambodian Party Delegation
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Friday met and had a talk with the visiting delegation of the FUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia led by Vice-Chairman Chap Nhalyvoud.

articles.title: Cambodian Party Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Cambodian Party Delegation Feted
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Friday gave a reception in honor of the visiting delegation of the FUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia.
					 Present there on invitation was the members of the delegation led by Vice-Chairman Chap Nhalyvoud and Sin Bunthoeurn, Cambodian ambassador.
					
					 Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Vice Department Director Ryu Myong Son and other officials of the C.C., WPK were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Parliamentary Delegation of Nepal Departs
articles.content:
Parliamentary Delegation of Nepal Departs
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- A parliamentary delegation of Nepal led by lawmaker Madav Kumar Nepal, former prime minister of Nepal and honorary chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, left here Friday after attending the Fifth International Festival in Praise of the Great Persons of Mt Paektu.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Leave
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Leave
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests left here Friday after participating in the 5th International Festival in Praise of the Great Persons of Mt Paektu.
					 They included the chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK who is co-chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu and his party, a delegation of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, a delegation of the Mongolian Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, the chairman of the Preparatory Committee of the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu and his party, a delegation of the Bulgarian Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, a delegation of the Belgium Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, a delegation of the Luxembourg Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, a delegation of the Ecuadorian Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) who is chairman of the Nepalese National Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il and his party, the chairman of the Ecuadorian Committee for Supporting Korea's Independent and Peaceful Reunification and his party, the chairman of the Cyprus-DPRK Cultural Friendship Association and his party, the secretary general of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, the secretary general of the Karachi branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, the director of Myanmar Medical Research Institute, the representative of the Choson Exchange Association in Singapore, the deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, the chairwoman of the Irish Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, the general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, the secretary general of the Romania-Korea Friendship Association, the chairman of the Haiti-Korea Cultural Association and the chairman of the Italian Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu.
					
					 Departing earlier were a delegation of the Ukrainian Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu and the executive secretary of the World Peace Council.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Here Visit KPA Museum of Weapons and Equipment
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Here Visit KPA Museum of Weapons and Equipment
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the Korean People's Army Museum of Weapons and Equipment on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 Being briefed on the exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt Paektu for building of the self-supporting and modern Juche-based defense industry, the members of the corps went round various kinds of weapons and combat equipment.
					
					 They also visited the Mangyongdae Children's Camp.

articles.title: Deputies to SPA Visit Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp
articles.content:
Deputies to SPA Visit Kim Jong Il's Birthplace in Paektusan Secret Camp
Samjiyon, August 18 (KCNA) -- Deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly on an expedition to the revolutionary battle sites around Mt Paektu visited leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp on Friday.
					 They laid bouquets at the mosaic mural depicting the three generals of Mt Paektu in the camp and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They looked back upon the revolutionary career of President Kim Il Sung at the headquarters log cabin located in the Sobaeksu Valley and keenly realized the traits of leader Kim Jong Il as a great man through the historical mementoes at the cabin.
					
					 They went round the monument inscribed with the poem "Shining Star" composed by Kim Il Sung on Kim Jong Il's birthday and the shallow well used by anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk and trees on which she inscribed revolutionary slogans.
					
					 They held an oath-taking meeting before the statue of Kim Il Sung at the Samjiyon Grand Monument. Attending it was Choe Yong Rim, honorary vice-president of the SPA Presidium.
					
					 At the meeting speakers said that the whole course of the expedition was the days when they deeply grasped the greatness of the peerlessly great persons and the indomitable fighting spirit of the anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners.
					
					 They hardened the will to defend and glorify the idea and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for building a Juche-based state and strictly apply the Juche-oriented view on the people, the people-first principle, in all fabrics of state and social life.
					
					 They called upon the participants to be true patriots and ardent vanguard fighters who keep their revolutionary faith to the death with the honor of being deputies to the SPA in the great era of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: More Rallies Held to Support Statement of DPRK Government
articles.content:
More Rallies Held to Support Statement of DPRK Government
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Rallies took place at institutions, industrial establishments and co-op farms across the country to express full support for the DPRK government's statement.
					 The government's statement was read out at the rallies before speeches.
					
					 Speakers charged with fury that the U.S. imperialists and their followers cooked up the harshest "sanctions resolution" by abusing the name of the United Nations Security Council, thus revealing their sinister intention to bring down the DPRK, fortress of socialism.
					
					 They were unanimous in absolutely supporting the statement of the DPRK government issued to categorically reject the "sanctions resolution" as an illegal and criminal document.
					
					 They warned that as clarified in the statement of a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army and the statement of a spokesman for the KPA Strategic Force, the U.S. persistence in reckless war hysteria and moves around the Korean peninsula would only bring the tragic end of the American Empire.
					
					 They expressed their resolve to decisively smash the enemies' anti-DPRK sanctions, holding higher the banner of single-minded unity and self-reliance and intensify the movement for creating the Mallima speed in all-out campaign towards the final victory of socialism.

articles.title: Pyongyang Dental Sanitary Goods Factory
articles.content:
Pyongyang Dental Sanitary Goods Factory
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Dental Sanitary Goods Factory produces various kinds of toothpastes and dental sanitary implements conducive to promoting the people's health.
					 Mun Yong Sun, chief engineer of the factory, told KCNA:
					
					 The factory is a general producer of dental sanitary goods with big capacity, built on the initiative of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It is operated by the automatic control system of production process and production and management control systems.
					
					 It is equipped with modern facilities like injector and six-color printer, putting the production on a streamlined basis.
					
					 In recent days, it developed more than ten kinds of functional and medicinal toothpastes and several kinds of dental sanitary goods including toothpaste for preventing pericementitis and Amur cork toothpaste.
					
					 The Korean people are extending thanks to Kim Jong Un for making them fully enjoy the advantages of the socialist healthcare system by seeing to it that the Pyongyang Dental Sanitary Goods Factory was built in the wake of the Breast Tumour Institute of the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, the Ryugyong Dental Hospital, the Medical Oxygen Factory and the Ryugyong General Ophthalmic Hospital.

articles.title: Pine Forest of Songdowon
articles.content:
Pine Forest of Songdowon
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Songdowon, a beauty spot of the world and a beach resort, situated in Kangwon Province, the DPRK is famous for its pine forest.
					 Songdowon is derived from the pine forest.
					
					 700-odd years ago, people of the area transplanted young pine trees in order to prevent sea wind and movement of sand. The trees made thick forest by the beach.
					
					 But pine trees were cut down by the Japanese imperialists who occupied Korea in the last century. They dug up even roots to extract turpentine for war supplies.
					
					 In the 1950s, the pine forest was severely destroyed again by the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung visited Songdowon on several occasions after Korea's liberation and after the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953) and took measures to plant many pine trees by the beach.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il said old pine trees of Songdowon are more precious treasure of the country than gold and led to take thorough measures for protecting the pine trees.
					
					 The area of the pine forest has been expanded by people there who turned out true to the behests of the peerlessly great men. Now, the pine forest adds picturesque to the scenic spot.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Stage No-War Demonstration
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Stage No-War Demonstration
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. simultaneously launched demonstrations in Washington, New York and Los Angeles on Aug. 14 in solidarity with American peace movement organizations to protest the U.S. moves for igniting a war against the DPRK, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 The demonstrators released a joint statement titled "The Trump government should stop north-targeted war moves at once."
					
					 Charging that Trump's bellicose remarks are bringing the danger of war to the Korean peninsula, the statement said:
					
					 Trump has fully revealed his true colors as a war maniac before the world by saying that the outbreak of war will kill thousands of people on the Korean peninsula only, not content with his reckless remarks about "fire and fury."
					
					 The peace treaty, to be signed soon after the conclusion of armistice agreement in 1953, has not yet been concluded due to the refusal of the U.S.
					
					 The ceaseless south Korea-U.S. joint military drills and north-targeted nuclear war drills under that abnormal situation caused the north's nukes and ICBM development.
					
					 Terming the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK the root cause of the danger of nuclear war on the Korean peninsula, the statement stressed:
					
					 The U.S. should give up its strategy for dominating Northeast Asia and hostile policy toward the north.
					
					 We strongly urge the U.S. administration to opt for dialogue and peace, not sanctions and war.
					
					 The U.S. should stop the north-targeted war moves at once and come out for dialogue with the north immediately.
					
					 It should declare the end of war and conclude a peace treaty.

articles.title: WPK's Line of Simultaneously Developing Two Fronts Is Eternal Banner of Peace and Prosperity: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
WPK's Line of Simultaneously Developing Two Fronts Is Eternal Banner of Peace and Prosperity: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts serves as a militant banner to emerge victorious in decades-long fierce showdown with the U.S. imperialists and as a powerful treasured sword to maintain an independent stand in the revolution and construction, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 This is also a driving force of leaping progress and prosperity as it helps bring an epochal turn in the economic development and the improvement of people's living standard by dint of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 The DPRK could reliably preserve the lifeline of Juche revolution and achieve big successes in building a powerful socialist nation without any vacillation despite difficulties and trials unprecedented in history as it has held fast to the Party's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts and bolstered up the military capability for self-defense with the nuclear force as a pivot.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and their vassal forces are now resorting to the harshest sanctions and pressure and provocations in a bid to prevent the DPRK's advance under the uplifted banner of the Party's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 The UN "sanctions resolution" those countries without principle cooked up, yielding to the U.S. and terming the DPRK's test-launch of ICBM, a just step for self-defense, "threat to global peace and security" is a product of the U.S. heinous moves to stifle and isolate the DPRK from A to Z. It is a wanton violation of the DPRK's sovereignty and an all-out challenge to it.
					
					 Simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of a nuclear force ensures the eternal victory and prosperity of our party and revolution, country and nation. Steadfast is the will of the Korean army and people to accelerate the final victory in the showdown with the U.S.-led imperialists by developing strongest strategic weapons, Juche weapons, much more under the uplifted banner of the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Should Not Irritate Compatriots in North: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Should Not Irritate Compatriots in North: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive Tuesday made an "address marking August 15." There he talked nonsense, asserting that "big challenge at present" is an "issue of the north's nukes and missile." He was so reckless as to talk about "international isolation" and "dim future."
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Friday says:
					
					 What the chief executive of south Korea uttered is just a revelation of his sinister design to kick the buck for the escalating tensions on the Korean peninsula to the DPRK and carry out his treacherous "north policy" with the backing of outsiders.
					
					 If the regime of south Korea truly wants peace, it should not recklessly fault the DPRK but clearly understand what is going on now. It should refrain from irritating the DPRK, pursuant to the U.S. foolhardy military maneuvers.
					
					 Misjudgment and ill-advised acts are bound to lead to bitter failure and regret.
					
					 The regime will have to face the most disgraceful ruin together with the U.S. if it persists in dancing to the tune of the U.S. hysteric moves.
					
					 It should choose a right way, well aware of where it should stand for the nation and peace now that the power and strategic position of the DPRK have reached their climax.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Draw Lesson from Present North-South Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Draw Lesson from Present North-South Relations
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- One hundred days have passed since the present chief executive of south Korea took office but his records during the days are poor and disappointed and affairs of inter-Korean relations, in particular, are a failure.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a commentary. It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities talked much about "dialogue" and "implementation of the north-south declarations" but their practice was quite contrary. Their call for "improved north-south relations" was little short of putting on airs.
					
					 The chief executive of south Korea seeks to stand against the DPRK in collusion with the U.S. persistently blocking the road of independent reunification after bisecting the Korean nation. His anti-national scheme was fully disclosed through "north's dismantlement of nukes" set as a target of the inter-Korean dialogue.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula is a matter to be settled between the DPRK and the U.S. from A to Z as it was spawned due to the U.S. persistent nuclear threat and blackmail on the former. The south Korean authorities have neither justification nor qualification to meddle in the issue.
					
					 The south Korean chief executive's call for "sanctions and pressure accompanied by dialogue" is an unpardonable anti-reunification theory, an expression of zealously following the U.S. gangster-like moves for stifling the DPRK.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities persistently resort to sycophancy towards the U.S. and cooperation in anti-DPRK sanctions, they will make themselves more dependent on the U.S. and thus become a miserable victim of the outsiders and face a catastrophic ruin only.
					
					 They should draw a lesson from the catastrophic north-south relations inching close to critical situation.

articles.title: S. Koreans Stage No-War Actions
articles.content:
S. Koreans Stage No-War Actions
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The 2017 Students Vanguard for Reunification and the Reunification Vanguard of the Confederation of Trade Unions in south Korea held a demo in Seoul on Aug. 14 in protest against Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises.
					 Holding a placard reading "Trump should zip his lip and give up Ulji Freedom Guardian!", the demonstrators chanted slogans demanding dismantlement of shackling alliance with the U.S. and elimination of evils stoking national division. They remained undeterred by the fascist police's suppression.
					
					 Earlier, they held a rally outside the U.S. military base in Ryongsan, censuring Trump's bellicose remarks and demanding stop to the joint military drill.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Demands Immediate Withdrawal of THAAD
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Demands Immediate Withdrawal of THAAD
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- South Korea's on-line newspaper Minjok Ilbo in an editorial on August 16 demanded immediate withdrawal of THAAD.
					 It blamed the regime for seeking to introduce THAAD equipment in addition in collusion with the U.S.
					
					 It accused the Ministry of Defense of insisting that the radio wave and noise of THAAD are not harmful to human body, when publishing the results of the test on its environmental impact on August 12.
					
					 The regime will be punished by the candlelight demonstrators if it behaves like the former Park Geun Hye regime which pursued sycophancy toward the U.S., prioritizing the alliance with it, it added.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Events such as seminar, book and photo exhibition and film shows were held in India, Bangladesh and Uganda between August 7 and 11 to mark the 72nd anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					On display at their venues were photos showing the revolutionary careers and undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					And there were books introducing the exploits of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu and pictures showing the achievements made by the Korean people in building a socialist power.
					
					S. P. Pathak, chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il, noted that Kim Il Sung embarked upon the road of revolution in his teens to liberate Korea from the Japanese imperialists' occupation.
					
					Vipin Gupta, chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India, said that thanks to Kim Il Sung, the Korean people could put an end to their fate of statelessness which had lasted for decades.
					
					Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, Mostafa Jamal Haider, secretary general of the Bangladesh Jatiya Party, and other speakers stressed that August 15 is a historic day when the Korean people came to enjoy an independent and dignified life as the masters of their destiny, state and society free from the colonial slavery of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					Personages of the Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement and the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea praised Kim Il Sung's feats for Korea's liberation, noting that the precious traditions of the Korean revolution established in the bloody days of anti-Japanese struggle are still given steady continuity.

articles.title: WPC Slams UNSC's "Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK
articles.content:
WPC Slams UNSC's "Sanctions Resolution" against DPRK
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The World Peace Council (WPC) on Aug. 9 made public a statement in denunciation of the UNSC "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK.
					 Expressing serious concern over the adoption of "sanctions resolution" 2371, the statement said:
					
					 The Korean people have the right to determine their own destiny and future for themselves.
					
					 We condemn the U.S. and its allied forces for their moves to violate the DPRK's sovereignty.
					
					 We also slam the military drills staged by the U.S., Japan and south Korea and the U.S. military presence in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. deployment of THAAD in south Korea will only escalate the regional tensions.
					
					 The Korean Armistice Agreement should be replaced by a peace accord.
					
					 We oppose the said sanctions and pain to be suffered by the Korean people and, in fact, the sanctions are a form of invasion and a prelude to military interference. But neither sanctions nor threat will work on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. is the country that used A-bombs for the first time in the world and, it is still now professing the theory of preemptive nuclear attack.
					
					 We extend full support to the Korean people in the struggle to defend the country's sovereignty from the vicious moves of the imperialists and ensure the regional peace and their country's independent reunification.
					
					 The UN should respect and follow the principles of the Chapter.

articles.title: Hungarian Party Backs DPRK ICBM Test-Launch
articles.content:
Hungarian Party Backs DPRK ICBM Test-Launch
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. should face up to the reality of Korea and think reasonably, stop resorting to the reckless war drills and contribute to the peace and security on the Korean peninsula.
					 The Hungarian Workers' Party demanded this in a statement on Aug. 11.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The DPRK's ICBM is a product of self-development as the Korean people made it all by themselves, and it is leading other countries in sci-tech development.
					
					 The DPRK is an indomitable country which does anything without fail if it is determined to do.
					
					 It had access to nukes and launched ICBM despite the U.S. and other Western countries' moves to stifle it. This clearly shows that no one can match the strength and will of the DPRK.
					
					 We fully support the struggle of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia alimentos de cumpleanos a intelectuales ameritados
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia alimentos de cumpleanos a intelectuales ameritados
Pyongyang, 18 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un envio alimentos de cumpleanos a la directora de la Escuela Primaria Maebong de la ciudad de Huichon, Kim Tae Sun, y al investigador de la filial de Hamhung de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, Pak Kyong Sik, cientifico benemerito, doctor y candidato a profesor titular, quienes cumplen 70 anos.
					Nacida como hija de un obrero de empresa forestal, Kim Tae Sun trabajo por varios decenios como maestra dedicando toda su inteligencia y pasion a la educacion de generaciones venideras. 
					
					Formo a muchos laureados del titulo de Profesor Ejemplar del 8 de Octubre y crio a los huerfanos durante la Marcha Penosa.
					
					Pak Kyong Sik, quien nacio como hijo de un jornalero en Japon, se graduo de la Universidad Kim Il Sung despues de su repatriacion. 
					
					Posteriormente, logro muchos exitos de investigacion trabajando durante varias decadas en la filial de Hamhung de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias y escribio los libros, manuales y disertaciones de mucho valor.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Kenia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Kenia
Pyongyang, 18 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 16 un mensaje de felicitacion a Uhuru Muigai Kenyatta por su reeleccion como presidente de la Republica de Kenia.
					Expresando la conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran aun mas en el futuro las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion existentes entre ambos paises, el remitente formulo votos sinceros por mayores exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario por la prosperidad del pais y el bienestar del pueblo.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con la delegacion de partido camboyano
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con la delegacion de partido camboyano
Pyongyang, 18 de agosto (ACNC) -- Ri Su Yong, miembro del Buro Politico y vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, departio el dia 18 con la delegacion del Partido Funcinpec de Camboya dirigida por su vicepresidente Chap Nhalyvoud, de visita en Corea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun hace balance de 100 dias de mandato del nuevo "poder" surcoreano
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun hace balance de 100 dias de mandato del nuevo "poder" surcoreano
Pyongyang, 18 de agosto (ACNC) -- Pasaron 100 dias desde la investidura del actual mandatario surcoreano.
					Al respecto, el diario Rodong Sinmun publico este viernes un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					Resulta decepcionante el registro de notas ganadas por el mandatario surcoreano durante 100 dias en el "poder". En particular, el salio suspenso en la asignatura de relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas hablaron mucho sobre el "dialogo" y la "ejecucion de la declaracion Sur-Norte", pero actuaron en el sentido contrario. Y no paso de ser una expresion superficial e hipocrita la "mejora de vinculos intercoreanos", aludida por ellas.
					
					Al presentar la "renuncia nuclear del Norte" como meta del dialogo intercoreano, el mandatario surcoreano expuso su plan antinacional de enfrentarse con la connacional RPDC confabulandose con EE.UU. que dejo dividida en dos partes a la nacion coreana y se obstina ahora en impedir la reunificacion independiente.
					
					El problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana es un asunto pendiente entre la RPDC y EE.UU. porque fue engendrado debido a la incesante amenaza y chantaje nucleares de EE.UU. contra aquella. Por eso, las autoridades surcoreanas no tienen ninguna justificacion ni derecho para meter su nariz en ese tema.
					
					La doctrina de "simultanear la sancion y presion con el dialogo", planteado por el mandatario surcoreano, tambien es la imperdonable teoria conflictiva anti-reunificacion que consuena con la bandidesca campana de presion anti-RPDC de su amo gringo.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas siguen cometiendo actos serviles a EE.UU. y cooperando con las fuerzas extranjeras en sancionar a la connacional RPDC, seran subyugadas aun mas por el imperio americano y condenadas a la destruccion.
					
					Ellas deben aprender la leccion ante la situacion catastrofica de relaciones intercoreanas que van de mal en peor.
